title: Oil Plate (Abura-zara or Andon-zara) for Placing under a Candle or Oil Lamp, the Plate with Decoration of Five Plum-Blossoms Roundels Reserved against a Moss-Dot-Flecked Bluish-Green Ground
dimensions: H. 2.5 cm x Diam. 21.5 cm (1 x 8 7/16 in.)
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Promised gift of Robert D. Mowry
medium: Seto ware: off-white stoneware with decoration painted in iron-brown slip within roundels, roundels covered with clear glaze and reserved against a ground of bluish-green copper glaze, the copper glaze suffused with localized areas of emerald-green "moss dots" resulting from copper saturation in those areas
provenance:
Robert D. Mowry, Brookline, Mass.  (bought in March 2007)
Kagedo Japanese Art, Seattle  (dealer)
Private collection, Japan
